newsitem.title: BELGIUM: UK's Simon declines comment on sterling strength.
newsitem.headline: UK's Simon declines comment on sterling strength.

text.p: British Minister for European Trade and Competitiveness David Simon declined to comment on Wednesday on whether sterling's strength was harming Britain's exports, saying it was too early to make a judgment.
"That's an impossible question to answer because it is a short run phenomenon in terms of the way most people look at economic competitiveness," Simon told reporters in reply to a question.

"Sterling goes up and down. It happens to be in one of its ups at the moment, but I think we ought to wait and see how continuous that's going to be," he said adding: "I would never answer that question on a short run cycle".
Simon was in Brussels to attend a ministerial meeting on EU single market issues.

British manufacturers have been complaining that the appreciation of sterling in the last nine months is hurting sales abroad. Since August last year, the pound has leapt by more than 50 pfennigs to 2.78 marks. -- Brussels newsroom 322 2876841
